title: bug: copying files to DigitalOcean Spaces using rclone causes timeout
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

`Copying files to DigitalOcean Spaces causes timeout`


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

`rclone v1.58.0`


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

`ubuntu 20.4`

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

DigitalOcean

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
rclone copy /root/foo.txt --s3-access-key-id=<ACCESS_KEY> --s3-secret-access-key=<ACCESS_SECRET> --s3-provider=DigitalOcean --s3-endpoint=https://bucket.nyc3.digitaloceanspaces.com :s3:foo --error-on-no-transfer
```


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
2022/04/17 06:35:54 ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 1 errors and: RequestError: send request failed
caused by: Head "https://foo.bucket.nyc3.digitaloceanspaces.com/foo.sh": x509: certificate is valid for *.nyc3.digitaloceanspaces.com, nyc3.digitaloceanspaces.com, not foo.bucket.nyc3.digitaloceanspaces.com
```

Now, if I run the following command the file gets copied without any issues. 

```
rclone copy /root/foo.txt --s3-access-key-id=<ACCESS_KEY> --s3-secret-access-key=<ACCESS_SECRET> --s3-provider=DigitalOcean --s3-endpoint=https://bucket.nyc3.digitaloceanspaces.com :s3:foo_bar --error-on-no-transfer
```

The only difference here is in the bucket name. The first one with issue uses a single word as bucket name which times out. The second one uses `_` in the bucket name and it makes it work.

Any help is much appreciated.
